full_summary:
## Event Management Solution

### Solicitation Information

* **Reference Number**: WS4607872707-Doc4607888256
* **Publication Date**: June 04, 2024
* **Closing Date and Time**: August 05, 2024, 2:00 PM ET
* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Address**: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, QC K1A 0S5, Canada

### Request for Proposal

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites suppliers to submit a proposal for an Event Management Solution. The solution should provide a cloud-based Software as a Service (SaaS) to support the delivery of services to enable the Event and Conference Management (ECM) group to work in an efficient and functional environment.

### Key Requirements

* Provide a cloud-based SaaS solution to support the delivery of services to enable the ECM group to work in an innovative, efficient, and functional environment.
* Allow the ECM group to focus more on their primary job function of managing events and conferences.

### Evaluation Criteria

The proposal will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical Merit (45% of the total score)
* Price (40% of the total score)
* Other considerations (15% of the total score)

### Restricted Procurement

This procurement is open to all qualified suppliers.

### Trade Agreements

This procurement is subject to the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact:

* **Scott Endicott**
* **Email**: [scott.endicott@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:scott.endicott@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* **URL**: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19909172?extsite=MTk5MDkxNzJfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

### Submission Instructions

* Responses will be accepted electronically through the Ariba Discovery platform
* Proposals must be submitted by the closing date and time listed above.
* Proposals received after the closing date and time will not be considered.

This entry should be rewritten to be concise, well-structured and clearly formatted. Make sure to remove any unnecessary information. Only include important and relevant details.
